Description: Rim and wall sherd (mended from two fragments) of possibly Attic black-glazed pottery lekane or small basin with flat-topped, squared rim; root of handle on right; glazed black throughout; band in added red (faded) around inside of bowl, traces of another on the inside of rim and a third on outside at lower break; inscription cut on top of rim.
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1888,0601.205. 226 pencilled on interior.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 66, no. 800, pl. XXI, no. 800)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 687, no. 448)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1893)
